author: pipermerriam
content: <@!353136597522448385> let me know when you're back.  I'm curious if https://eips.ethereum.org/EIPS/eip-2584 is representative of your latest thoughts on the conversion to a binary trie?  What (if anything) would you want to do on the EIP prior to bringing it up in an ACD call soon

author: Deleted User
content: Sorry, I am late to the party but I finally got my head around the binary tree format discussion, and I would like to ask why variant M3 did not make it into the EIP: https://ethresear.ch/t/binary-trie-format/7621/19

author: Deleted User
content: I think the concern about M3 was a small implementation detail which is biased towards a specific implementation. But the great thing about M3 is that it is very flat data model friendly, does not require bit-twiddling, does not have extensions (anti-feature), and does not use RLP (also anti-feature for the hash trees)
